reviews.text: My company use both Hilton hotels in Mainz. I like both of them, but i do like the city a little better. The location is right in the old town and is off the main streets. The staff are so helpful, and the rooms are a nice size. The breakfast was very good, they will do some cooked to order items if you ask. My room was a deluxe room, but to me it was more like a Jr. Suite, a nice sitting area, table and fresh fruit. The bed was nice, the bathroom was a nice size. It is a smaller hotel and I like that.. Really nice place..
reviews.title: Nice little hotel with a wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night here with my spouse on holiday.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel, good location near city center and train station

reviews.text: Check-in was very quick, agent spoke flawless English and was very welcoming. I am a HH Diamond member. Agent confirmed there is no Executive Lounge at this property, but did offer free wireless internet in the room. Asked if we would like breakfast in the morning and when we said our checkout would be early she offered two breakfast boxes. Be sure and ask for these at Hilton if your checkout is before 7am!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our second visit just as much as the first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is more typical for western European standards (seemed on the small side) but did have a chair and ottoman and a desk and chair, as well as a king bed with separate duvets.
reviews.title: Great hotel in city centre

reviews.text: Bathroom appeared newly renovated with Crabtree & Eveylyn amenities. No bathrobe provided, but there was a pair of slippers. Combo tub/shower.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to stay in the city of Mainz on our way back from Austria. We arrived late in the Hilton Mainz. A Hilton hotel usually meets our standards, but this time it wasn't that good.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The room (roomnr. 123) has no view. It was not cleaned very well and had a very strong odor. We had the feeling that only the bedlinen were changed....
reviews.title: Great hotel by Schillerplatz

likes.disliked: — The cost of the Internet access

reviews.text: The hotel is a tipical business hotel. It's large, a lot of business travelers and groups. It is easy to find, but it's not near the city center.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for your stay in Mainz

reviews.text: Mainz is wonderful by the way, but I would never recommend this hotel to anyone I know.
reviews.title: Torn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a little gem close to all public transport, shopping and restaurants. The main Hilton by the Rhine is much larger so this one has a boutique feel.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: US: We booked this hotel in January when the economy was in the pits for 69.5 EURO per night including breakfast. We are Hilton Gold members.
reviews.title: Average hotel, Superb Front Desk assistance, OK location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good
reviews.title: Really Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Supposedly received upgrade to executive room, but it wasn't particularly special except for maybe being a little larger (keep in mind, all Hilton rooms are bigger than normal European). Welcome gift of some fruit and bottled water in the room for us.
reviews.title: Good value, if you get a discount. Beware of breakfast staff!
Beware!!! The reservations may be un-cancelable!!
reviews.text: - English was a little less solid here, but the front desk staff was very friendly to check us in and orient us with the city.
- Typical in-room coffee machine. Standard regular style TV.
reviews.title: Average hotel, excellent breakfast.

reviews.text: Mainz is a pleasant city for a stopover, there is a pedestrian area between Weissliliengasse / Kirschgarten / Marktplatz with half-timbered houses and views on the Cathedral (see images). At the Weissliliengasse, there is a craft brewery called Eisgrub: a trendy (and crowded) place for locals.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at perfect location to explore Mainz

reviews.text: There are two Hiltons in Mainz, one is situated along the Rhine (from ouside looked the business purpose type), while the "City Mainz" is more of a larger boutique-style hotel, ideally situated in a quiet park area (see image).
reviews.title: Half the price of the Hyatt
Very classy and friendly service
reviews.text: The receptionist Sabina extends a very warm welcome. There is a bar in the lobby and an inner court for the nice part of the year.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The comfort room is classy (see image) and, for German standards, particularly roomy. Same applies for the marble styled bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with wonderful service
Hilton Mainz
reviews.text: The only issue I had, was that the Nespresso machine was on, but did not function. It was repaired when I was back in the room. I think, it is not ecological and likely no good for these machines (nor for TV's and the like) to have them permanently switched on. My suggestion : PLEASE SAVE ENERGY.
